intro: Thrixgyne dura, commonly known as the hardy thrixgyne, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pale yellow to deep red, depending on the variety. Thrixgyne dura is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that allow it to access underground water sources. Its resilience makes it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
